description: The BSEPACK contains a set of subroutines for solving the Bethe-Salpeter Eigenvalue (BSE) problem. This type of problem arises in this study of optical excitation of nanoscale materials. The BSE problem is a structured non-Hermitian eigenvalue problem. The BSEPACK software can be used to compute all or subset of eigenpairs of a BSE Hamiltonian. It can also be used to compute the optical absorption spectrum without computing BSE eigenvalues and eigenvectors explicitly. The package makes use of the ScaLAPACK, LAPACK and BLAS.
name: Bethe-Salpeter Eigenvalue Solver Package (BSEPACK) v0.1
